12.text:
One in two children in England
 worry about school bullying

15.text:
students who are seen as different
are the ones most likely to be bullied.

20.text: Recent Research has revealed that at age 7,

22.text:
children with disabilities are more likely
 to be bullied all the time by their classmates.

28.text:
Children with Special Educational Needs
 are also twice as likely

31.text:
to be bullied compared to those
 with no known disabilities.

35.text:
at age 15, young people with
disabilities are at a higher risk

39.text:
of being excluded from friendship groups
 and experiencing cyber bullying,

46.text:
and spreading rumours
on Facebook or Twitter.

49.text:
Students with Special Educational
Needs face the same risk.

53.text: They are also more likely to be threatened

57.text: Children and young people who are bullied

59.text: end up feeling isolated and alone.

62.text:
They are more likely to skip class,
run away from home,

66.text:
The scars of bullying
stigma can last for a lifetime.

69.text:
Victims face a higher risk
of being depressed in adulthood

72.text: and of faring worse in the labour market.

75.text: Many victims don’t speak about their experiences.

78.text: It doesn’t have to be that way.

80.text: Nobody should put up with bullying.

82.text:
We might all be different
but deserve to all be treated equally.

85.text:
Whether you face or witness bullying
reach out and make a noise.

89.text: Share this video and help put an end to bullying.
